BIBOO
//Kai imports WELCOME SIGN UP LOGIN Terms and Conditions Data Privacy Act of 2012 Â© Copyright All rights reserved. ANIMALIA SCORE ANIMALIA GAME INFORMATION ANIMAFICATION: ANIMADIET: POINTING SYSTEM: GAME LIST LAND ANIMALS AQUATIC ANIMALS AERIAL ANIMALS PREHISTORIC ANIMALS
Given with jumbled letters and an image, the task is to identify the animal by typing its name in the provided text area. Hints will automatically show once three wrong answers were reached.
Based on the animal shown, the player needs to identify which diet it is classified into. Gain points by dragging the correct animal food into the animal diet area. The player can use hints, which will eliminate one animal food that is not a possible diet of the given animal with the cost of 300 points
Each correct answer will gain players with 100 points. However, streaks can help gain even more points. Achieving 2-4 winstreaks is equivalent to 300 points per correct answer, while 5-9 winstreaks will equate to 500 points per correct answer. But with 10 winstreaks and above, players can gain 1000 points per correct answer. Accumulate points to achieve high scores and climb the way to the top of the leaderboards!
Land animals are a varied group of organisms that inhabit terrestrial environments, ranging from microscopic insects to large mammals. They have adapted to life on land, developing structures such as legs or limbs for locomotion and diverse survival strategies in different ecosystems. Aquatic animals, residing in water environments, exhibit a wide spectrum of adaptations for life beneath the surface. From streamlined fish with fins for swimming to marine mammals like dolphins, these organisms have evolved diverse traits to navigate and thrive in aquatic habitats. Aerial animals, also known as flying animals, have evolved unique adaptations for life in the skies. From agile birds with wings for flight to insects employing intricate wing structures, these organisms demonstrate remarkable abilities to soar and navigate through the air. Prehistoric animals, existing in the vast expanse of time before recorded history, encompass a fascinating array of now-extinct species. Ranging from colossal dinosaurs to early marine lifeforms, these ancient creatures contribute to our understanding of the Earth dynamic evolutionary history.
